summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons memorandum from a correctional officer detailing the response and procedures following the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It documents the timeline of events from the officer's assignment to hospital detail, through the securing and preparation of Epstein's remains, to their transport to the city morgue by the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose remains are the subject of the memorandum. He is identified by his name and BOP register number 76318-054.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: The memorandum is addressed to this lieutenant, who requested the emergency hospital detail.

persons.name: Correctional Officer
persons.context: The officer who wrote the memorandum, detailing their response and duties on the hospital detail for inmate Epstein's remains.

persons.name: Institution Duty Officer
persons.context: Took command of the hospital detail, coordinated communications with the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner and A/W, and oversaw the movement of remains.

persons.name: Director of OCME
persons.role: Director of Office of City Medical Examiner
persons.context: Communicated with the IDO regarding receiving and transporting Epstein's remains to the city morgue.

connections.description: The officer was assigned to guard/watch the remains of inmate Epstein.
The IDO communicated and coordinated with the Director of OCME regarding the transfer of Epstein's remains.
The IDO took command of the detail involving the correctional officer.

events.title: Epstein's Death and Initial Morgue Transfer
events.description: Following the death of Jeffrey Epstein, correctional officers were detailed to New York Presbyterian Hospital. His remains were prepared by hospital staff, moved to the hospital morgue, and later transported to the city morgue by the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
keyFacts: The document is a contemporaneous record from August 10, 2019, detailing the immediate official response to Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
Epstein's remains were initially at New York Presbyterian Hospital (room A9 in the emergency room) before being moved to the hospital morgue.
The Institution Duty Officer (IDO) coordinated the transfer of Epstein's remains from the hospital to the city morgue with the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME).
The timeline shows a process lasting from approximately 8:45 am to after 1:03 pm for securing and transferring the remains.
The document establishes a chain of custody and official procedure following Epstein's death, involving multiple BOP officers and city medical examiner staff.
